Description: Pair of cymbals: the broad rims of the cymbals are slightly turned up at the edge, so that the point of contact is towards the central, saucer-shaped depression. The rims have a pronounced flange on the back of the cymbals. The holes for suspending the cymbals are comparatively large.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: 'A Guide to the Fourth, Fifth and Sixth Egyptian Rooms, and the Coptic Room' (1922), p. 212. H. Hickmann, 'Cymbales et crotales dans l'Égypte ancienne', 'Annales du Service des Antiquitiés de l'Égypte', 49 (1949), p. 521
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
